citeinfo.title: Sensitive Ecosystem Inventory for Metro Vancouver (2014)

descript.abstract: A Sensitive Ecosystem Inventory (SEI) was conducted for the Metro Vancouver region and Abbotsford from 2010-2012, using 2009 imagery. An update to that inventory was conducted for the Metro Vancouver region only from 2015-2018, using 2014 imagery. Provincial SEI standards were followed to identify and map ecologically significant and relatively unmodified 'Sensitive Ecosystems', including wetlands, older forests and woodlands. In addition, 'Modified Ecosystems' such as old fields and young forests, which are human modified but still have ecological value and importance to biodiversity were included in the mapping process. The project area totaled 330,600 ha, consisting of terrestrial lands plus rivers, freshwater bodies, intertidal and estuarine zones. Two main approaches were used to build the inventory of polygons based on the availability of Terrestrial Ecosystem Mapping (TEM) products. TEM was used to generate SEI values in the Coquitlam, Capilano, and Seymour watersheds; the Regional Parks network; and Mount Seymour and Indian Arm Provincial Parks. Riparian fringe and gully SEI classes could often not be directly translated from TEM so had to be newly generated. For remaining areas with no existing TEM, SEI mapping was developed through image interpretation followed by selective field checks to confirm and inform mapping decisions. For new mapping, 20% of polygons were checked in the field. Polygons were delineated at 1:5,000 (new mapping) to 1: 10,000 - 1: 20,000 (originating from TEM). Sites as small as 0.5 ha were mapped, with the exception of some “Modified Ecosystems”, where only larger instances were mapped, e.g., greater than 2.5 ha for old fields, and greater than 5ha for young forest. Some sites originating from TEM were smaller than 0.5 ha and these were also included in the inventory. Key attributes of class and subclass, structural stage, stand composition, condition and size were recorded for each component within a polygon. Although a polygon can have up to three ecosystem components, attempts were made to map as many pure sites as possible (i.e. one component). Other attributes of biogeoclimatic unit, landscape context, disturbance factors and ecosystem 'quality' were recorded for the polygon as a whole. In the 2014 update, inventory polygons were assessed with the primary purpose of detecting removals or disturbances during the previous 5 years. Corrections were also made where needed.Users of the SEI must take into account certain limitations inherent with this type of dataset and consider how those limitations may impact the intended use of the information. This includes differences between the dataset and actual site conditions that could be due to human error, classification difficulties, and changes to the site occurring after the date of the imagery or field work. The dataset is considered accurate at the scale it was delineated at and should not be enlarged beyond this. The SEI does not replace the need for on-site assessments to support any decisions made for a particular area.Visit www.metrovancouver.organd search ‘SEI’ to access the SEI Technical Report.
descript.purpose: Provides the location and attributes for sensitive and important modified ecosystems throughout Metro Vancouver.

idinfo.useconst: To be used only in accordance with a data sharing agreement with Metro Vancouver
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.5.1.7333

attr.attrdef: Combination of BGC Zone/subzone/variant
Sensitive Ecosystem Subclass of Ecosystem Component 1
Internal MV field. MV department the data is associated with.
Field to identify the agency or organization where the data originates
Stand Composition Modifier of Ecosystem Component 1 - Differentiates forest stands based on coniferous, broadleaf and mixed stand composition
Condition assessment for component 3 expressed as a number. 5 (best) to 1 (worst)
Used only when polygon originates from MV TEM. Internal MV field. Specific name of park or watershed
Structural Stage of Ecosystem Component 1
Area of polygon covered by ecosystem component 2
Used only when polygon originates from MV TEM. Internal MV field. Type of ecological or administrative unit
Quality assessment for component 1, combination of condition, landscape context and size rating
Final quality grade for the polygon (based on WCombQuality) expressed as A (best) to E (worst)
Microsite - ecosystem representing < 10% of the polygon
Condition assessment of the third component present in the polygon. A (best) to E (worst)
Condition assessment for component 2 expressed as a number. 5 (best) to 1 (worst)
Structural Stage of Ecosystem Component 2
Project Type - Indicates the type of mapping project
Field Plot number
Total quality rating for the polygon, combining the weighted quality ratings for each component (WQuality_SE1, WQuality_SE2, WQuality_SE3)
Date of amendment
Size grade for component 3. A (best) to E (worst). Based on SumWSize_SE3
Quality assessment for component 2, combination of condition, landscape context and size ratings
Disturbance (of least importance)
Disturbance (of greatest importance)
Class and type (sensitive, modified or non-sensitive) of Ecosystem Component 3. Labeling field
Structural Stage Substage or Modifier of Ecosystem Component 3
Class and type (sensitive, modified or non-sensitive) of Ecosystem Component 2. Labeling field
Condition assessment of the first component present in the polygon. A (best) to E (worst)
Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of polygon covered by ecosystem component 3
Ecosystem Decile of Ecosystem Component 1 - Proportion of the polygon covered by ecosystem component 1, in deciles.
Sensitive Ecosystem Class of Ecosystem Component 2
Field check of polygon - describes the level of field checking done on the current polygon
Condition assessment for component 1 expressed as a number. 5 (best) to 1 (worst)
UUID (Universal Unique Identifier).
Sensitive Ecosystem Subclass of Ecosystem Component 3
Sensitive Ecosystem Subclass of Ecosystem Component 2
Area of polygon covered by ecosystem component 1
Area of polygon covered by ecosystem component 3
Landscape context assessment for the entire polygon. A (best) to E (worst)
Brief details of the amendment made
Project Identification - A unique identifier for each project
Size grade for component 1 expressed as a number. Based on SumWSize_SE1
Area of polygon covered by ecosystem component 1
Structural Stage of Ecosystem Component 3
Size grade for component 3 expressed as a number. Based on SumWSize_SE3
Ecosection Label - Component of the hierarchial Ecoregion Classification system
First initial and surname of mapper
Sensitive Ecosystem Class of Ecosystem Component 3
Feature geometry.
Condition assessment of the second component present in the polygon. A (best) to E (worst)
Sensitive Ecosystem Class of Ecosystem Component 1
Size grade for component 2. A (best) to E (worst). Based on SumWSize_SE2
Ecosystem Decile of Ecosystem Component 2 - Proportion of the polygon covered by ecosystem component 2, in deciles.
Disturbance
First initial and surname of the mapper who made the amendment
Final quality grade for the polygon (based on WCombQuality) expressed as a number – 5 (best) to 1 (worst)
Structural Stage Substage or Modifier of Ecosystem Component 1
Area of polygon covered by ecosystem component 2
Stand Composition Modifier of Ecosystem Component 2 - Differentiates forest stands based on coniferous, broadleaf and mixed stand composition
Quality rating (QualityNo_SE1) weighted by the proportion of the polygon covered by component 1
Quality rating (QualityNo_SE3) weighted by the proportion of the polygon covered by component 3
Size grade for component 2 expressed as a number. Based on SumWSize_SE2
Quality rating (QualityNo_SE2) weighted by the proportion of the polygon covered by component 2
Status of component 1 as sensitive, modified or non-sensitive ecosystem
Status of component 2 as sensitive, modified or non-sensitive ecosystem
Status of component 1 as sensitive, modified or non-sensitive ecosystem
Structural Stage Substage or Modifier of Ecosystem Component 2
Polygon Number - An identifying number for polygon being mapped
Used only when polygon originates from TEM. Identifying number for the related polygon in the TEM dataset
Ecosystem Decile of Ecosystem Component 3 - Proportion of the polygon covered by ecosystem component 3, in deciles.
Disturbance
Stand Composition Modifier of Ecosystem Component 3 - Differentiates forest stands based on coniferous, broadleaf and mixed stand composition
Size grade for component 1. A (best) to E (worst). Based on SumWSize_SE1
Quality assessment for component 3, combination of condition, landscape context and size ratings
Date the data was sourced or created
Type of modification observed
Land use change observed (i.e. from Sensitive/Modified Ecosystem to a different land use)
Additional information about land use change
Holds the original SEI Polygon Number. Provides a link between the update and the original 2009 SEI
Class and type (sensitive, modified or non-sensitive) of Ecosystem Component 1. Labeling field
Polygon comments
Landscape context assessment for the polygon expressed as a number. 5 (best) to 1 (worst
Was this polygon added or deleted between 2009 and 2014?

Quality score for 2009, adjusted. Wherever there is I in Change_Qual, 2014 quality score is brought in. For polygons noted as CHANGE in Change_Qual, 2009 values used. For 0-Diff0914 and NoChange in Change_Qual use 2014 (doesn't matter, same 09 and 14); For polys added since 09, and for NC polys, deleted polys and polys with no quality in either 09 or 14 use N/A;
Used in summarize to determine which polygons to assess quality for.

attrvai.attrva: QAll - Assessed for quality in both 09 and 14; Q09 - Assessed for quality in 09 but not 14; Q14 - Assessed for quality in 14 but not 09; DEL - not assessed for quality in 09 or 14 OR assessed for quality in 09 but not 14 (delete before running summarize)

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
